covered_points: Clearly distinguishes between process-oriented (Chat) and goal-oriented (Agent) frameworks.
Details how tool use/API integration expands capabilities beyond model parameters.
Explains the action execution component that differentiates agents from chat systems.
Categorizes different approaches to agent implementation.
Examines potential economic disruption and employment impacts.
uncovered_points: Explains how user expectations naturally progress from being impressed by AI conversation to demanding practical task execution.
Provides relevant historical analogies to similar technological evolutions (e.g., smart speakers, voice assistants).
Explains the planning capabilities of agent systems for task decomposition.
Describes the memory requirements and differences between short-term and long-term retention.
Articulates how AI agents change traditional software development methodologies.
Explains the shift in developer roles when working with autonomous systems.
Names and accurately describes specific agent frameworks (e.g., AutoGPT, AutoGen, ChatDev).
Compares strengths and limitations of existing agent frameworks.
Identifies specific model limitations affecting agent systems.
Discusses economic constraints including operational costs and price-to-performance ratios.
Addresses broader societal concerns including safety, privacy, and ethical considerations.
